title.narrative: Sustainable Crop Production, Utilization, and Resource Management through Capacity Enhancement

description.narrative: According to the Government of Timor-Leste’s National Food Security Policy, the major causes of food insecurity are the widespread practice of subsistence agriculture combined with the lack of alternative sources of income necessary to counter agriculture’s low productivity. Over 80% of the population relies on agriculture for both food and income. By targeting the interrelated causes of low agricultural productivity and lack of income opportunities, this action addresses the problems of underdeveloped agricultural services, weak market linkages, and household vulnerability against shocks. The action targets 4,500 chronically food insecure rural households (approximately 22,500 people) in four sub-districts of Ainaro and Manufahi Districts with an emphasis on small-scale farmers and extension workers. Target households currently struggle to meet their food needs and require more in-depth technical and managerial skills to alleviate the constraints they face at the market, community, and household levels. Through a combined community-based, market-led approach that actively engages multiple stakeholders; the program is addressing the following constraints: (1) Market level: poor market information flow and linkages; lack of irrigation; unavailable inputs; (2) Community level: insufficient technical skills in agricultural production and storage; lack of farmer coordination; low capacity of extension workers; and low capacity of Suco Councils and non-government organizations (NGOs); and (3) Household level: inability to manage household assets and food needs against annual shocks.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
